column1: Last weekend's warm and sunny weather meant a beautiful day to register voters in #NJ03!   Sign up to join us again this weekend in Burlington at https://t.co/4KkEt5z4k9 or in Marlton at https://t.co/0vx9ys9NRs. https://t.co/5YZYw5P0Wf

My neighbors in New Jersey know what’s at stake in this election and that’s exactly why our grassroots support is stronger than ever with 90% of our donors giving under $100. Thank you for being on my team and standing with me as I continue to fight for the people of NJ-03. https://t.co/289ekwvgXX

Senator Booker’s voice makes our party stronger and his vision will help make our country stronger. While he’ll be missed in this process I know he’ll continue to fight for New Jersey; and I’ll continue to fight alongside him. https://t.co/rTru2xufwB

We're just two hours away from the stroke of midnight and that means just two hours before this critical deadline.  Click on the link below and make your final contribution of the decade count.  https://t.co/CADX2DtqOX
We don't take corporate PAC money and our average grassroots donation is under $100 so we're counting on supporters like you.   Help us hit our goal and donate today: https://t.co/q3IgVB0LWk
Today is our biggest fundraising deadline of the year. Andy and our finance team are working around the clock because we need to show that our campaign is in a strong place as we head into 2020.
Wishing a very Merry Christmas from my family to yours. May your holiday season be filled with love and light. https://t.co/01F9aL1gEP
Wishing a very happy first night of Hanukkah to everyone celebrating. May you be surrounded by those you love and blessed with peace and happiness. Chag urim sameach! https://t.co/fz0Uw3Inxi
That’s what’s at stake; more money for you or more money for corporate CEOs and billionaires. You know I’ll always be on your side. https://t.co/sJuLghMfTP
I’m working hard in Congress to fight back against this and put money back in your pockets. The job isn’t done and if Republicans take back the House odds are it’ll never be.

Today marks the two year anniversary of Washington Republican’s direct assault on New Jersey taxpayers with the passage of their tax law. This bill had one aim: give corporations and billionaires a tax break paid for by working families like yours.
Proud to have voted to limit the influence of money in politics and grateful for your support! #HR1 https://t.co/wd0eyR0WxA

I’ve held fifteen town halls over the past year and at every one I hear from my neighbors across New Jersey that they want to protect access to health care while making it more affordable; that’s exactly what I’ve worked to do and exactly what people across our state deserve.
This decision shows the obsession we’ve seen from Republicans to take away health care from millions of Americans. https://t.co/C9ZqzlYrsA
The Senate stands in the way of making an impact in the lives of everyday Americans with dangerous consequences.   They need to act now.

https://t.co/fkPSvZUzHz  As I reflect back on my first year in office I am proud of the over 400 bills that we have passed including a pay increase for our troops and the lowering of prescription drug costs.   But the fight isn’t over.

I just voted Yes on the articles of impeachment. As a national security official I worked under both Republicans and Democrats because the oath I swore was to the constitution not to a political party. I will always fight to protect our democracy. -AK
But today my heart is with their families as we honor the memory of those they lost.

There are few moments I recall as vividly as learning that 26 innocent lives many of them small children were lost.   I will honor their memories by continuing the fight to pass gun safety measures at every opportunity.

I remember exactly where I was 7 years ago when I heard about the shooting at Sandy Hook.   I was working on the seventh floor of the State Department in the Deputy Secretary’s Office when I saw a small tv in the corner showing scenes of children running from the school.
The work isn't done. We need the Senate to act. But this is a big step for the more than 120000 people in our district alone that would benefit and one we should all be proud of. #HR3 #NJ03

When I ran for Congress I told you I'd fight for everyone struggling to pay for the medicine they need and the care they deserve. Today we passed a bill that would make life-saving drugs affordable and expand Medicare to cover dental vision and hearing.

The first responders were heroes that prevented additional loss of life. I stand with Jersey City and will do everything I can to keep guns out of the hands of deadly criminals like the ones we’ve seen today. -AK

https://t.co/S9IHpdn2Dc Right in our own state multiple lives were tragically cut short in Jersey City. Our state and our nation mourn the loss of a police officer who courageously responded to the shooting and innocent bystanders caught in the line of fire.

The first responders were heroes that prevented additional loss of life. I stand with Jersey City and will do everything I can to keep guns out of the hands of deadly criminals like the ones we’ve seen today.
I fought to serve on the House Armed Services Committee and I'm proud to be an voice for our New Jersey's Joint Base and our veterans every day.   https://t.co/8LesULrkQE

Today I was proud to lead bipartisan legislation that supports our veterans. The National Defense Authorization Act will provide funding for new jobs in Burlington County phase out chemicals that impact military community groundwater and increase access to job training programs
I look forward to continuing my work alongside them in this Congress and in the future as we seek to make a better more secure country for the next generation.
I'm proud to be endorsed by the Brady Campaign and their members throughout Burlington and Ocean Counties because they've been a leader in fighting for safer streets and schools.
I want to do everything I can do make sure that my two baby boys don't have to grow up afraid of going to school because Congress hasn't acted on common-sense gun safety laws.
I was in high school during the Columbine shootings and have seen a generation raised in an era of school shootings. https://t.co/gI2VOwGwFV

I’m proud to be a voice for New Jersey’s working people and a staunch advocate for their rights to organize for a fair day’s pay for a hard day’s work and for serious infrastructure investment in our country that will support our communities and create good paying jobs.
Working people built this country and deserve a Congress that looks out for them and not partisan corporate interests. https://t.co/WUKhAUj1nI
Read through these stories in the article and let’s keep working together to support those struggling in Burlington and Ocean Counties and across this country.

We’ve made progress in this fight but not nearly enough.   Big Pharma companies still pocket profits while communities suffer and our local leaders struggle for resources to help those who need it most.

Their stories of opioid addition arrest recovery and death after the introduction of OxyContin are sadly ones we hear in New Jersey and across the country as we continue to struggle from a public health crisis that has claimed the lives of hundreds of thousands.
This article was one of the more powerful that I’ve read lately. Like the people in this story I graduated high school in 2000.  https://t.co/TziII2N51m
I hope that you and your loved ones are also surrounded by things to be thankful for on this day and every day.   -AK

I am thankful for the New Jersey rest stops and Wawas that keep me fed and and energized as I travel across the district.  And I am thankful for my family. My wife Kammy and my two little boys who bring me joy every day and who are the reason I do the work that I do.
I am thankful for the beauty of my district from the sandy beaches that line our coast to the parks that welcome our communities and the state forests protected by our state.
I am thankful for our veterans who sacrifice and serve our country bravely so that we may have safety and freedom.

Today I have so much for which to be thankful.  I am thankful for the community in New Jersey’s third district for the people who chose me to represent them in Congress and who put their faith in me each and every day to serve them truthfully and honorably. https://t.co/cQkWWEz80P
expand background checks for gun purchases and mitigate the effects of climate change. I’m proud to have helped lead the way on every one.

This year the House of Representatives has passed hundreds of bills including those to expand voting rights and protect elections from foreign interference lower prescription drug costs https://t.co/EV6rihXuNe

Lucy you are an inspiration to us all. Jordan’s memory lives on every day through your fight to end gun violence and make communities across our country safer. Thank you for your bravery. My thoughts are with you and your family. https://t.co/axaQDjMD50
My Helping Seniors Afford Healthcare Act would increase their Medicare savings and put money they desperately need back in their pockets.

Seniors in Burlington and Ocean Counties struggle to afford basic needs every day because of the consequences of rising healthcare costs. I've watched my own mother crunch numbers late into the night to see if she will be able to make ends meet. https://t.co/QNKDP9qy7l

Today let’s take a moment to thank our veterans for their service. We are grateful for the sacrifices you made in order to preserve our freedom and humbled by your courage and bravery. We honor you today and every day. https://t.co/cZBsAutqbx
🗳 Polls in New Jersey close in less than two hours! (8:00pm)   🔎 Find your polling location here: https://t.co/ogD9fBqYxY https://t.co/Q4RbapojoJ

Excited to be with my friends Gina LaPlaca and Mark Natale launching canvass kickoffs in Marlton in the final hours before the polls close at 8pm. If you haven’t voted yet there’s still time. Let’s make sure our voices are heard and get Mark and Gina across the finish line! https://t.co/GjMLCHRZQR
Five and a half hours left to go before the polls close! Every voice should be heard and every vote will be counted. Share this to remind your friends to get to the polls before 8pm tonight.

Happy Election Day everyone! It's time to get up and go out to the polls to support great candidates like Gina and Mark. Will you commit to reminding four friends or family members to vote today? Polls are open until 8pm tonight. https://t.co/MHlY3IIruN

This is not what leadership looks like. Climate change is one of the greatest challenges of our time and one that will have a lasting impact on the lives of our children. Simply ignoring this crisis is unacceptable. https://t.co/mxy8jnxCvt

Tomorrow is #ElectionDay in New Jersey; do you have your plan to vote? Check out this link to find your polling place and make sure you get out there and have your voice heard. https://t.co/ogD9fBqYxY

Election Day may be Tuesday but candidates like Mark Natale and Gina LaPlaca have already been fighting every day to make sure Burlington County has the representation we need. Help them get across the finish line by remembering to vote this Tuesday November 5th! #LD8 https://t.co/bvUh5MonWl
Tuesday is #ElectionDay in New Jersey; do you have your plan to vote? Check out this link to find your polling place and make sure you get out there and have your voice heard. https://t.co/ogD9fBqYxY
My seat has been named one of the top races to flip by Republicans and my next FEC filing deadline is tomorrow. Can I count on you?  https://t.co/20q3Gx2S0J

The Commander in Chief should be held to the highest standard. President Trump has violated that standard and our nation's trust. If proven true his actions constitute an impeachable offense. https://t.co/7cZBjqPD46

Today we remember reflect and honor not only those who lost their lives 18 years ago but also those who rose in service in response to those attacks. Today and everyday we stand together as a country commemorating this day that we will never forget. https://t.co/NcptYcTu7T
Five lives lost and nearly two dozen wounded including a 17 month old with shrapnel in her chest. I can’t imagine what Odessa is going through but our families in New Jersey stand with you.

The head of a hospital system in Odessa Texas said “Anybody that hears the sound of my voice you need to grasp onto your loved ones and hold on to them and pray for this town.” https://t.co/N6Y0xKowEx

Last week the House overwhelmingly voted to permanently extend the 9/11 Victims Compensation Fund. If ever there is a place for bipartisanship it is to do everything we can for these heroes. We need this bill passed through the Senate immediately. https://t.co/D8Gd8YNX8l

Thanks for all the birthday wishes today!  I’ve been having a great day filled with fun with friends and family. My son had a great day for a different reason as he found a sprinkles cupcake the size of his head. https://t.co/bVRAJ0ejoB

Happy 4th everyone! My family and I had a wonderful time celebrating our nation at the Riverton parade and also at great gatherings across Ocean county. Hope you all got to enjoy some time with your friends and family! https://t.co/Q4ZRMbeYGD

The deadline is tonight at 11:59 PM. Help us hit our fundraising goal & post a strong fundraising number when it goes public. Challengers backed by corporate interest are waiting to see how we do. Here’s the best link to chip in https://t.co/BhK1Gv2lsQ -- Team Andy

Voters should pick politicians and not the other way around. Today the SCOTUS could have stopped partisan gerrymandering but they ruled against it. It's a reminder of why we need to continue fighting and what is at stake. https://t.co/uC83KSeVvD

Proud to have the @LCVoters stand with our campaign. Every day I think about making sure that our kids can grow up in a world where they don't need to worry about the air they breathe or the water they drink. There's too much at stake for every family across our country. https://t.co/bm2m9JrWtP

It’s the issue that comes up more than anything else” said Kim elected on a pledge to improve health coverage. “This is what motivated me to run Health care is very personal to me. https://t.co/1s4ycmisHc

When you elected me I promised to listen. That's why I've hosted 5 town halls reviewed and responded to over 17000 letters and attended more than 100 meetings with constituents since taking office in January. https://t.co/ZHuNz6vHuu

Sat down with the @BurlcoTimes to discuss my first 100 days: - Passed HR1 a landmark bill to preserve our democracy - Into'd the bipartisan SAVE Act to expand access to healthcare - Opened 3 constituent services offices in BC & OC - Hosted 4 town halls https://t.co/eIhrwrJppd
A message from my son when he woke up far to early this morning  — Happy Easter! https://t.co/QdWQzGDxQ2
Proud to announce we've raised over $550000 in the first three months of 2019. Thank you for your ongoing support! Over 90% of our individual contributions were under $100. https://t.co/HAh6PlUJvc
Got to love opening day! https://t.co/S1Px4rmPQb

We must with united voice condemn the terrorist attacks that took the lives of 49 people at two mosques in New Zealand. We stand with the people of New Zealand and with Muslim communities there and abroad who deserve to live and worship with security.  https://t.co/6CPqFayUei

I read this article about curing HIV in amazement of what scientists are able to do and the extraordinary benefits these discoveries could potentially unleash. These breakthroughs give millions hope and we must commit to investing in critical research https://t.co/pYYxluiLYL

@CoryBooker represents the best of New Jersey and the best of America. I'm proud to stand with him and work together to put power back in the hands of working people and create a better life for our next generation. #Cory2020 https://t.co/IQaaijUH4L

Just listened to powerful interview with Parkland students reflecting on today’s anniversary. They talk about pursuit of closure despite knowing they likely will never feel it. I wish them all strength today and everyday. We will always stand with you. https://t.co/3k19djKNAF
@ColinAllredTX Congrats you two!  I have lots of baby gear to pass along
John Dingell gave our nation a lifetime of service. A remarkable 59 years in Congress. Love and strength to @RepDebDingell and family. https://t.co/QpgXBvpydL

Be safe outside as the cold is at dangerous levels. Code blue alerts are activated. At this link are warming centers in Burlington and Ocean counties. If you need a place to stay or you see anyone outside who doesn’t have shelter please look at this info. https://t.co/iEkqJFEA7t

I’m excited to hear what @staceyabrams will say. She inspired me when I first met her about 5years ago and she inspired me every day when I saw her on the campaign trail running on integrity and a new vision. https://t.co/p3KUFRi8UX

“If public service loses its allure it will make it harder to recruit and hold onto the experienced and talented those who can build spacecraft but also the people who battle epidemics predict hurricanes and keep the food supply safe.”

I’ve known many talented public servants who left government because the challenges of navigating civil service were too frustrating. This article highlights that this shutdown is hurting us now and could hurt our personnel talent for years to come. https://t.co/L5DDhC4iNY

Powerful interview with @GabbyGiffords  “It’s possible to be both tough and civil. You can stand up for what you believe in while recognizing that in order to make change happen we ultimately need to bring people together.” https://t.co/Wr2gdC2dOA
